title: Update version to v1.17.15
body:
Nothing in this commit except the version bump:

```
$ glol -1
97eb9f2dc2 2024-01-02 16:42:01 -0600  (HEAD -> version_bump_v1.17.15, origin/version_bump_v1.17.15)  will.hickey@solana.com Update version to v1.17.15
$ git diff v1.17..HEAD | grep -vE "^ |^@@ |^--- |^\+\+\+ |^index |^diff |^-( \")?solana.*1.17.14|^\+( \")?solana.*1.17.15|^-version|^\+version"
$
```

title: stake: Remove feature `stake_merge_with_unmatched_credits_observed`
body:
#### Problem

While going through the stake program code, I noticed that `stake_merge_with_unmatched_credits_observed` is still in there, when it's been enabled for over two years. And then I confirmed that it was mine in https://github.com/solana-labs/solana/pull/18985

#### Summary of Changes

Remove the feature gate, and update a test that was an old function. The removed test case is no longer valid since we relaxed the `credits_observed` equality requirement.

Fixes #
<!-- OPTIONAL: Feature Gate Issue: # -->
<!-- Don't forget to add the "feature-gate" label -->

body: See https://github.com/hyperledger/solang/releases/tag/v0.3.3

title: zk-token-sdk: Fix incorrect mention of OsRng in docs
body:
#### Problem

The documentation of BatchedGroupedCiphertext2HandlesValidityProof::verify mentions use of `OsRng`.

This function is used in Zero-Knowledge Token Proof Program instruction processing. Therefore use of OsRng would break consensus. 

#### Summary of Changes

It looks like the problematic comment was copy pasted from somewhere else as is not valid. Please double check that this is actually the case.

Removes the problematic comment. 

Fixes #
<!-- OPTIONAL: Feature Gate Issue: # -->
<!-- Don't forget to add the "feature-gate" label -->

title: build(deps): bump regex from 1.9.5 to 1.9.6

labels.name: automerge
labels.description: Merge this Pull Request automatically once CI passes

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [regex](https://github.com/rust-lang/regex) from 1.9.5 to 1.9.6.
Changelog

Sourced from regex's changelog.

1.9.6 (2023-09-30)

This is a patch release that fixes a panic that can occur when the default regex size limit is increased to a large number.

  • BUG aa4e4c71: Fix a bug where computing the maximum haystack length for the bounded backtracker could result underflow and thus provoke a panic later in a search due to a broken invariant.
Commits
  • 11b4443 1.9.6
  • 3dda425 deps: bump regex-automata to 0.3.9
  • 03f00bd regex-automata-0.3.9
  • e467408 changelog: 1.9.6
  • aa4e4c7 automata: fix unintended panic in max_haystack_len
  • 27a2538 automata: add some #[inline] annotations
  • 061ee81 readme: visually emphasize performance criteria difference
  • 8275c1b doc: fix a few typos
  • cdc0dbd readme: add section about performance and benchmarks
  • 4aaf389 ci: pin to memchr 2.6.2 for MSRV CI job
  • See full diff in compare view

title: Add release-with-debug profile
sdk, programs/bpf_loader: add sol_remaining_compute_units syscall
body:
#### Problem

Instructions may want to maximise their use of the compute budget, without risking going over budget. To do so, they ought to be able to inspect the current budget consumed.

#### Summary of Changes

Implement a syscall that allows SBF programs to make queries of `sol_remaining_compute_units` at arbitrary points in execution.

- Fixes #18134
- Rebased revival of #18227 (note that I dropped a - it seemed to me - unrelated change to the cost of `sol_log_compute_units`)

#### TODO

- [x] Feature gate pubkey
- [x] Docs link to "invalid_link". The existing link for another syscall goes to an arbitrary blob on github. I don't think I can fill that before the PR is merged.
- [x] The C sdk header additions are untested. How is this typically tested?
- [x] `programs/sbf/rust/early_terminate` has a program_test, so I could check the call works as expected. Is this the usual way to test?
